application.doc: Retrieving the current state of all instances

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve All Reverse Proxy Instance Status
method.doc: To retrieve the current state of all instances with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the Reverse Proxy resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

representation.name: retrieveAllReverseProxyInstanceStatusJsonResponse
representation.doc: Note: Response body is an array.

param.name: id
param.doc: The unique identifier for this instance.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Whether this instance is enabled. Valid values are "yes" and "partial".

param.name: started
param.doc: Whether this instance is started. Valid values are "yes" and "no".

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version of the instance .conf file. This is the last modified time of the file. A numerical number that indicates the number of seconds since the Epoch (00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 1970)

param.name: restart
param.doc: Indicates whether this instance needs to be restarted to allow configuration changes to go into effect.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
